questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) has a complex Salesforce org which has been developed over the past five years. Internal users are complaining about multiple data issues, including incomplete and duplicate data in the org. NTO has decided to engage a data architect to analyze and define data quality standards.
Which three key factors should a data architect consider while defining data quality standards? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Define key fields in a staging database for data cleansing.
choices.E: Define data duplication standards and rules.
choices.C: Identify an extract, transform, load (ETL) tool for more complete data migrations.

choices.E: Define the system of record for critical data.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
B-) Create a data archive strategy: Given the large volume of customer records spanning 25 years, having a well-defined data archive strategy is crucial. This strategy will help in managing historical data efficiently, ensuring that it is stored appropriately and can be retrieved when needed without affecting the performance of current systems.

C-) Define the systems of record for critical data: Identifying which systems are the authoritative sources for critical data is fundamental to a master data management strategy. This helps in establishing data governance, ensuring consistency, and maintaining data quality across different systems.

A-) Identify data to be replicated: Understanding which data needs to be replicated and how it should be managed across different systems is essential for maintaining data consistency and accuracy. This involves deciding on data synchronization mechanisms and replication rules to support a unified view of customer data.
